messages.message: oh what. Is it always this this test that takes forever?
seems like it? i remember having problems with this test in the past too

I tried skip that test as well and still yield same
total test run time of running all tests should be within 10 minutes but we see often 40+, I think we are paying a lot penalty here that we should be able to avoid

we can also just like. `--forceExit` if needed

also, note that `-t` still takes time to skip a test, because it has to look at the test file; compared to `-i` which just runs the one file. in particular running `-t "somethingthatsnotreal"` on my laptop still takes 5 minutes to skip all tests
yeah but the data from the full run does not subject to that skipping time (or very minor since only a few are skipped) and yet it still shows a big gap
do you have a link to the full run?

```Test Suites: 2 skipped, 898 passed, 898 of 900 total
Tests:       23 skipped, 4 todo, 5780 passed, 5807 total
Snapshots:   30 passed, 30 total
Time:        2299.939 s
Done in 2301.21s.```
is this also the case without `--verbose`? iirc the jest printing adds significant overhead, though idk if it adds _that_ much overhead...
i would try with `--forceExit` first and see if that helps
but also, i am confused about how this happens....

OK I was mainly trying to see if there is any room to improve those test runtime that FE team may or may not aware of, I honestly don't have a lot of time on this, if anybody in FE is interested in poking around and figure it out then great, otherwise I can leave it as is.
I am not sure about the general experience here. and maybe I am just paranoid and this is not a real issue :shrug:
